node.title: Stolen School Bus Rams Cars in New York City, at Least 1 Officer and 1 Civilian Hurt
node.alt: At least one officer and one civilian were injured after a man allegedly rammed a stolen school bus into vehicles in Brooklyn on Thursday. Above, a school bus is parked outside in New York City on November 19, 2020 in New York City.
node.description: The suspected driver of the stolen school bus was taken into custody Thursday afternoon, authorities said.
node.content:
["At least one police officer and one civilian were injured Thursday when a stolen school bus rammed into vehicles in New York City's Brooklyn borough.", "The incident began Thursday afternoon when a school bus that police said had been stolen \"fled\" along Jackie Robinson Parkway in Brooklyn's Cypress Hills neighborhood, according to police. The school bus eventually ended up within the jurisdiction of the NYPD's 73rd Precinct, where it broke down.", "", "
At least one officer and one civilian were injured after a man allegedly rammed a stolen school bus into vehicles in Brooklyn on Thursday. Above, a school bus is parked outside in New York City on November 19, 2020 in New York City.
", "Information regarding the arrested individual's name or age were not immediately available, police said. Motives behind the theft of the bus and the path it took through the streets of Brooklyn have not yet been determined, but the NYPD said the incident is currently under investigation.", "At least one police officer suffered \"minor\" injuries, the NYPD said. At least one civilian was also injured when his vehicle was struck, but the NYPD spokesperson said that individual's injuries were also minor and that he was in stable condition. Further details regarding the nature of the officer's and civilian's injuries were not immediately available.", "Shortly after the stolen bus drove through the city streets, video began spreading on social media that appeared to show a school bus driving into vehicles, some of which appeared to be parked while others appeared to be stopped along the streets. In one video, officers could be seen chasing after the school bus on foot while dodging other vehicles in the path of the bus as those vehicles were struck. Bystanders could be heard yelling and screaming as sirens blared in the background.", "WABC-TV reported an estimated 15 to 20 vehicles were struck as the bus drove through. Helicopter footage shared by the station Thursday evening showed multiple streets containing vehicles that may have been damaged as the school bus forged its path."]
